meanings.definition: A person who buys and sells goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The traders at the market were busy selling fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The traders exchanged their goods for money at the trade fair.
meanings.sent3: The traders decided to have a competition to see who could sell the most items.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, traders are like skilled negotiators, always seeking the best deals.
meanings.sent5: The image of traders haggling in the bustling marketplace stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in trade or commerce.
meanings.sent1: Traders from different countries gathered to discuss international commerce.
meanings.sent2: The local traders formed a union to protect their interests in the market.
meanings.sent3: The traders joked about opening a shop on the moon for intergalactic trade.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a trader of ideas, always exchanging thoughts with others.
meanings.sent5: The history books were filled with tales of legendary traders who sailed the seas in search of riches.
